title: @Riot : Fun Facts about Yorick!
body:
-Yorick was released 1,348 days ago, on June 6, 2011.
-Yorick last got a new skin on that same day.
-Yorick was last free 845 days ago, on November 6, 2012.
-That was during Season 2.
-The last time the Yorick Rework was mentioned as being worked on by Riot was 422 days ago, on January 3, 2014.
-The Rework was stated to be put "on ice" on December 15, 2014. No news since then.
-The last change made to Yorick was 332 days ago, on April 3, 2014. He got his base armor increased by 4. This was also the same day that every single champion in League of Legends got their base armor increased by 4.
-Yorick is the 4th least popular champion in Normal mode (as of the time of this writing), beating only Urgot, Zac, and Galio.
-Yorick is the 7th least popular champion in Ranked Solo/Duo mode (as of the time of this writing), beating only Urgot, Zac, Galio, Kog'Maw, Singed, and Elise/Skarner (depending on if you're looking at daily, weekly, or monthly)
-Since January 28, Yorick was picked 61,000 times in ranked games.
-Since January 28, Graves was picked 1,559,000 times in ranked games.
-Yorick really digs Graves.

Taken from: http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/2xl8rh/fun_facts_about_yorick/

Necromancers are my favorite archetype in fantasy. When I first saw Yorick was going to be a ghoul-summoning, life stealing, necromancer that could cast animate dead on allies to raise them for a short time after death, I was like HOLY CRAP! This is going to be my main!. . .

Nope. 

Went back to being a Vladimir main after I learned he's super uninteresting as a character and as a playstyle. I honestly think he should've been more Azir-like with more direct control over an undead force.

When Riot said they had a Necromancer skin in mind for Azir I was like, Oh, so Haunted Zyra and this Necromancer Azir skin will be MUCH better than league's ACTUAL Necromancer 

/butthurt

League of Legends needs a more interesting character to fill its Necromancer archetype.
Yorick is neither the necromancer League needs, nor is it the necromancer League deserves.
